caption: Love the pizza here and the service. We usually hang out at the bar or the outdoor seating. The outdoor spots are quiet despite the sidewalk setting. The bar usually keeps a couple of local beers on tap, but nothing to go wild about if you're a beer person. It's still a nice set up though with a good atmosphere and lots of space inside so you can spread out.
Slim selection
Awesome staff. Great management. My favorite pizza in the area
Just like the Anthony's in New Jersey.
Great pizza, wings, and customer service!
First time ordering and both the pizza and service were fantastic. Looking forward to ordering from here for years to come

Excellent customer service and taste! Extremely efficient and friendly folks who were courteous and quick. We placed a large order and they even threw in an extra small pizza- so sweet! Their pizza is awesome, garlic knots are incredible and the salads were big and tasty. Will absolutely be coming back, so glad we ordered from here!
Great pizza and friendly staff. I suggest that you get extra cheese as the pie I ordered was sparsely covered with cheese   Nonetheless, it was tasty.
Amazing food ALWAYS GREAT :)

Ate here last night. Got a pepperoni pizza and garlic knots. Pizza was really good and garlic knots were amazing. The pizza was a bit too charred just on the edges though but it was still really good. Will go back for sure.

Anthony's pizza is off the hook.  We ordered the a pepperoni  and a cheese and we were licking our lips. My son had a piece for breakfast.  ;).   The crust was just right and I loved their sauce.  We also ordered the garlic knots too.  Sooo good.  This place is a great addition to the dmv area.  kudos to you.  :)))))
Two words: parking violations. Didn't even get to order food.
Pizza was very good and the long peppers had my lips burning!! Can't wait to go back!
Best pizza I've had in a long time. Very friendly staff.

After visiting Anthony's in Bethesda a few times I had to write a review. Let me tell you, their meatballs and Margarita pizzas are second to none! Chioma was quick to refill my stella and was very entertaining. Definitely going to be coming back!
The coal really works, and the meatballs are delicious. The meatball and ricotta and carnivori are my favourites.
It was so good I recommend the chicken wings

My mom told me that the pizza here was the 💣 and she was not lying!!  When I walked in I was greeted by very nice waiters (Adon and Taylor) food makers (Niko)and bartender(Adon again). Everything was clean and the setup of the restaurant was very neat 👍. The pizza wings and drinks I got were awesomee they came really fast!
Great experience .our first  time Authentic. Wood burning  oven pizza- great Pinot noir Good service. Definitely coming back!
Amazing homemade pizza, absolutely worth it
Always good food and great service.
Amazing handmade pizzas!! Try the Carnivori for meat lovers!!
I wanted to love this place sooo bad. The pizza was just okay and the wings were flavorless and burnt (I think they’re supposed to be lemon pepper?). But customer service was good!
(Translated by Google) For lovers of wood-fired pizzas, I recommend it.  (Original) Para los amantes de las pizzas a leña, lo recomiendo.

The waitress is so weird he doesn’t smile very very awkward vibe he doesn’t even speak and keeps raising up his brows and looking at us. Burnt pizza on the edges food not so bad but needs to be better. Overall wasn’t happy with how the waitress was he was sweeping the floor while we were eating very unprofessional. Many wasps were flying around the food.
Very good high quality pizza with great crust. My only complaint would be to have just a little more sauce on the pizza.

First-time patron of the Anthony's on Norfolk Ave. in downtown Bethesda. Outdoor and indoor seating options and the staff, thankfully, all wore masks (as did guests). Like another reviewer, my pizza came to me with a rim of completely burned, black crust which, when explained to me by the server and, separately, by the manager, is because of the 900-degree oven temp. because of the use of coal (hence, "coal-fired pizza").  Also likely more burnt on rim due to thinness of pizza.  I would have preferred not eating pure carbon and some more red sauce than only in a few scattered places, but it was still good...though, nothing beats unmatched NJ/NY pizza.
The meals and service were above my expectations. We surely liked the environment of this place. Fantastic spot to take my family out for lunch.

Decided to dine out Friday night with my partner. This location was very slow for a Friday night which was fine by us. I can not remember our waiters name but he was awesome. The small salad was huge, meatballs were great. I prefer a touch more salt but I believe a good meatball leaves a little room for added flavor for diversity. Pizza was awesome and well worth the price. We plan to head back on Monday for their pizza and salad special and then Wednesday for the pizza and  wing special. Probably not the same week, but maybe lol the cocktails were awesome. It didn't feel like we were at a chain. I didn't know it was a chain. Awesome food and ambiance. Generous 5 5 star because I wouldn't personally change anything.
Fantastic experience! Delicious food, and great service. Neko the manager and Adon the server were generous and accommodating.  Would definitely recommend.

When I went, it was packed and it was the grand opening. Servers were a little clueless and kept asking how the food was and checking on my table. Usually servers check on the customers 1-2 times in a meal, but these servers asked more than 5 times. And there were multiple servers that asked us. Other than that the food wasn’t bad. Nothing life changing but pretty good pizza.
The best pizza.!!!
Order 16” cheese pizza. Needs more sauce. Cheese gets over cooked and very chewy.

I've dined in once and I've done takeout once.  Dine in was when they first opened and they were packed.  Server forgot about us for the first 10 minutes until we finally said something.  Food was great though.  Takeout was a different story.  Ordered online for pickup at 6:45.  Arrived well before the pickup time ~6:35 and was asked my name, which was provided.  6:45 rolled around and I inquired about my order.  Turns out, they hadn't even started my order and I was told it would be approximately 5 minutes.  That turned out to actually be 10 minutes.  When I got home and inspected my pizza, the crust was burnt to a crisp, black.  I realize these are unique times, but set expectations around pickup and wait times properly.  Then when trying to rectify a mistake, don't compound it by burning the food.  Seems like they're rather make a $ than care for the customer.

Pizza was good, more on the sour side (we like sweeter).  But this review is low for another reason.  On the night of May 10th, 2020, well into the covid era and after Maryland officially reacted, the majority of the staff of this establishment was not wearing any form of face coverings.  The staff seen were three individuals making the pizzas (one of them was wearing a mask, the others not), and the front-store worker (female who was interacting with the customers, giving pizzas, etc, also not wearing a mask and seen to interact closely with those making pizzas when not up front waiting for customers).  I was not the only ones to be uncomfortable with this, as I saw a couple walk out with their pies looking back and commenting in disgust that the workers were not wearing protection.  Particularly since the well lit/illuminated restaurant is on a busy corner, with big windows - I'm sure we are not the only one that noticed.  While the back store workers pose less risk, the front store worker was in disregard of Maryland Order Number 20-04-15-01 Section II.a.v, as well as respect for the safety for customers and staff, and also common sense.  Said Order states: "all Foodservice Establishments shall require staff who interact with customers (including, without limitation, delivery personnel) to wear, and those staff shall wear, Face Coverings while working."  Regardless of the food, I would not consider it wise to eat from this establishment until they conform with health orders, common sense, and a better safety culture - for their safety and particularly for the customers/public.

Ordered a takeout combo pizza, with wine and Italian salad. The order was ready on time. The pizza was delicious! Wine was also good as well, lots of variety. The only big issue was the salad prep. They only offer the dressing on the side, which is poorly kept in a flimsy plastic container. Lo and behold that container exploded in the bag getting everywhere.  If you want pizza or wine, not a bad place at all... but avoid takeout salads.

FANTASTIC PIZZA ! Always make a point to go to Anthony 's for their excellent Pizza while in Florida. So very happy to see they opened one in Bethesda Md. They also will  be opening one in  Fairfax Va. near me this year. Until then I will make the drive.  IT IS THAT GOOD ! Excellent managers and staff.
Amazing food!
Good  handmade pizza

(Translated by Google) The place looks nice and with good service, however I ordered 2 pizzas to go: the capresa had no pesto or basil sauce and the pepperoni was very poor in pepperoni.  (Original) El lugar se ve agradable y con buena atención, sin embargo ordene 2 pizzas para llevar: la capresa no tenía salsa pesto ni albahaca y la de peperoni muy pobre en peperoni.

We've been to Anthony's a couple times now and it's been great each time! We've enjoyed their wings, salads, pizzas (the Fra Diavolo is a personal favorite), and cocktails (I recommend their take on the Mule). Despite the restaurant being very busy, service has always been friendly and efficient - Jared and Tina are lovely! Anthony's is a welcome addition to the neighborhood - we'll definitely be back.

We went here for the first time last night for dinner and left impressed.  Despite just having opened this location, the service was great with not only the server themselves being attentive, but several managers coming by (appreciate the coupon Jared, if you see this). The attention wasn't overbearing, rather it was all the more notable considering how packed the restaurant was.  We came for the pizza of course, which was great, with thin crispy crust having a charred taste that did justice to the restaurant's name and quality sauce (not too much) and cheese that completed each pie. Don't skip the meatballs however, as they may well have been the star of the show.  Recommended, we'll be back.
Great atmosphere, awesome food and super friendly staff!
Iceberg lettuce. Nothing special about the salad. Pizza was burnt. Was BARELY edible.
Limited options for my vegan wife
I had chicken wings, and they were very god. The bartenders,  great customers service.

I hosted the monthly happy hour for my company, The David Munson Agency at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza last night! We had approximately 20 people so we utilized the back bar space, which worked perfectly for our group! They had delicious bar drinks that everyone enjoyed, and the service was excellent. Can't wait to go back soon!

(Translated by Google) The waitress was very friendly and diligent but the kitchen was slow. We ordered two pizzas and one of the pizzas came out 15 minutes later because the chef burned the pizza when the restaurant was almost empty. We ordered a cheesecake for dessert and it also took a long time to leave. The pizzas were good but not worth the wait.  (Original) La camarera fue muy amable y diligente pero la cocina fue lenta. Pedimos dos pizzas y una de las pizzas salió 15 minutos más tarde porque al cocinero se le quemó la pizza cuando el restaurante estaba casi vacío. Pedimos una tarta de queso de postre y también tardó mucho en salir. Las pizzas estaban buenas pero no merece la pena la espera.

The original wings were bland- needed more seasoning and a sauce. The food was just okay. There are a multitude of Pizza and wings spots in the Bethesda area. Therefore, the competition is high. First time visiting and not interested in coming back. The ambience is nice though.

Soooo yup anther amazing meal at Anthony’s! Managers are upbeat and very helpful, happy, good vibes! waitress we had today was very nice very attentive! Food as always, so delicious and my kids never turn dinner at Anthonys😋 this is. Great place!
Excellent! Fantastic pizza, wings, salads, drinks! Great service! Wonderful experience! Delighted to have this place in Bethesda!
Solid pizza, good service, nice atmosphere
Great time was had by all. Good pizza great atmosphere.
Absolutely LOVED the meatball sandwich. Fantastic food, great staff, and great drinks.

Quite legitimately the best pizza I have ever had.  Wings were very good, as were the drinks.  For it being brand new, the staff seemed very knowledgable too.  Liked the atmosphere of the restaurant as well.  The only bad thing I can say is the fact they had no sauces for wings (and my GF likes ranch with  her pizza).  But on the grand scheme of everything, having no sauces is not a big deal in comparison to how good the pizza was.

I’m not sure whose giving 5 Star reviews. But this is something that should be at the mall! The host was rude and playing on her phone totally ignored us. The restaurant was not busy. tbe Pizza was not cooked as good as the other locations! We asked for wings without the Onions on top and of course they bring us wins with plenty of Onions!  They need to fix these basic issues they just opened at this terrible corner with no parking and are the fifth business to try at this corner. Hopefully they get it right. Otherwise I’ll stick to MB down the block.  There a million pizza and wing places in the DMV you better get your ducks in a row. Because I tried you guys once and nothing calling me back to try you again.
I really wanted to like this place, but the pizza missed the mark. Fresh ingredients, but the dough was too thick and certainly not coal charred. Mostly chewy, no real crunch.

We went during their soft opening and really enjoyed it.  The food was great (we particularly loved the wings and the "traditional" pizza), and so was the service.  Brian, Sam, and Jasmine were working the very busy bar area, and they handled everything quickly and with a smile.  We were particularly impressed because restaurants usually have some issues to work out during a soft opening, but everything seemed to be going great.  We're excited to have Anthony's in the neighborhood and expect we'll be back frequently.

Excellent all the way around.  Pizza, wings, meatballs are all top notch and delicious. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. We are so happy to have this great lively restaurant in our hood and they are open late night too! Welcome to Btown, Anthony’s.
